anka-coder.author: Andrey Makarov
anka-coder.name: Anka/Coder
anka-coder.variants: regular, bold, italic, bold-italic; in regular, condensed and narrow widths.

anonymous-pro.author: Mark Simonson
anonymous-pro.description: Anonymous Pro is an evolution of the original Anonymous, adding lots of character sets and styles.
anonymous-pro.name: Anonymous Pro

apl2741.author: Adrian Smith
apl2741.description: This was hand digitised as a PostScript Type-3 font from an original 2741 golf-ball salvaged from an IBM selectric typewriter.
apl2741.name: APL2741

apl385.author: Adrian Smith
apl385.description: Developed with all APL software vendors in the late 1980s and enhanced as required with new characters to meet interpreter updates. Thanks to Dave Liebtag (IBM), Richard Nabavi (APL.68000) and all at Dyalog APL for their support.
apl385.name: APL385

aurulent.author: Stephen G. Hartke
aurulent.description: Aurulent Sans is a humanist sans serif intended to be used as an interface font.
aurulent.name: Aurulent Sans Mono

average.author: Richard Alexander Hall
average.description: AverageMono is an average of thirteen different fonts which are all derivatives of the public domain Courier typeface.
average.name: Average Mono

azeret.author: Displaay
azeret.description: The story of the typeface began with a draft that was driven by an exploration of OCR fonts, past and futuristic operating systems, various interfaces and the nineties.
azeret.name: Azeret Mono
azeret.variants: A variable font, available in various weights.

b612-mono.author: Nicolas Chauveau, Thomas Paillot and Jonathan Favre-Lamarine
b612-mono.description: B612 is an highly legible open source font family designed and tested to be used on aircraft cockpit screens.
b612-mono.name: B612 Mono

bedstead.author: Ben Harris
bedstead.description: Bedstead is a family of outline fonts based on the characters produced by the Mullard SAA5050 series of Teletext Character Generators.
bedstead.name: Bedstead

bigblue-terminal.author: VileR
bigblue-terminal.description: It follows the metrics and dimensions of Windows' old Terminal font (at the 9pt/12px size), but the appearance is closer to the classic IBM PC text mode character sets.
bigblue-terminal.name: BigBlue Terminal

binchotan-sharp.author: Rabbit Viceroy Klein
binchotan-sharp.description: A fixed-width typeface. Horizontal metrics compatible with CJK console fonts. Small size legibile.
binchotan-sharp.name: Binchotan Sharp

bitstream-vera.author: Jim Lyles
bitstream-vera.description: Vera is a digital typeface (computer font) superfamily with a liberal license. It was designed by Jim Lyles from the now-defunct Bitstream Inc. type foundry.
bitstream-vera.name: Bitstream Vera Sans Mono

borg-sans-mono.author: Marnen E. Laibow-Koser
borg-sans-mono.description: Droid Sans Mono Slashed + Hasklig-style ligatures!
borg-sans-mono.name: Borg Sans Mono

bpmono.author: Backpacker
bpmono.description: A monospaced typeface suitable for technical texts and/or programming
bpmono.name: BPmono

bront-dejavu.author: Chris Wendt
bront-dejavu.description: Bront is a collection of tweaked fonts geared towards programming.
bront-dejavu.name: Bront DejaVu Sans Mono

bront-ubuntu.author: Chris Wendt
bront-ubuntu.description: Bront is a collection of tweaked fonts geared towards programming.
bront-ubuntu.name: Bront Ubuntu Mono

camingocode.author: Jan Fromm
camingocode.description: Based on CamingoMono, but has several specially drawn glyphs that work well at small sizes.
camingocode.name: CamingoCode

cartograph.author: Connary Fagen
cartograph.description: A monospaced typeface with character and warmth, Cartograph is a handsome font family featuring a lush, cursive italic, code-friendly ligatures, and a proportional set accessible via OpenType.
cartograph.name: Cartograph
cartograph.variants: 8 weights and various alternatives via OpenType sets, including ligatures.

cascadia-code.author: Aaron Bell
cascadia-code.name: Cascadia Code
cascadia-code.description: This is a fun, new monospaced font that includes programming ligatures and is designed to enhance the modern look and feel of the Windows Terminal.
cascadia-code.variants: 6 weights and various alternatives via OpenType sets, including slashed zeroes and cursive italics.

comic-mono.author: Thai Pangsakulyanont
comic-mono.description: A legible monospace font… the very typeface you’ve been trained to recognize since childhood. This font is a fork of Shannon Miwa’s Comic Shanns.
comic-mono.name: Comic Mono

comic-shanns.author: Shannon Miwa
comic-shanns.description: Do you lie awake every night dreaming about a world where you could write your code in Comic Sans where it looks just as beautiful as on your dear presentations?
comic-shanns.name: Comic Shanns

commit-mono.author: Eigil Nikolajsen
commit-mono.description: Commit Mono is an anonymous and neutral coding font focused on creating a better reading experience.
commit-mono.name: Commit Mono
commit-mono.variants: A download can be customized with various of weights, ligatures, dotted or slashed zeroes, and other styles.

courier-prime.author: Alan Dague-Greene
courier-prime.description: We set out to make the best damn Courier ever.
courier-prime.name: Courier Prime

courier-prime-sans.author: Alan Dague-Greene
courier-prime-sans.description: The goodness of Courier Prime without the serifs.
courier-prime-sans.name: Courier Prime Sans

courier-prime-code.author: Alan Dague-Greene
courier-prime-code.description: The goodness of Courier Prime without the serifs. Code-optimized for programmers
courier-prime-code.name: Courier Prime Code

cousine.author: Steve Matteson
cousine.description: An innovative, refreshing sans serif design that is metrically compatible with Courier New.
cousine.name: Cousine

drafting.author: Owen Earl
drafting.description: An ode to our past.  A celebration of inconsistencies.
drafting.name: Drafting* Mono

edlo.author: Eric Hamiter
edlo.description: Edlo is a modified version of Stephen G. Hartke’s Aurulent Sans, which I thought was beautiful, but hazardous for programming because the similarities between zeroes and ohs and ones and els were too close for comfort.
edlo.name: Edlo

ellograph.author: Connary Fagen
ellograph.description: A friendly monospaced typeface with a soft, rounded construction and striking cursive italics. A generous x-height and short descenders allow for even, flowing lines of text.
ellograph.name: Ellograph
ellograph.variants: 8 weights, italics, and additional OpenType variations.

fairfax.author: Rebecca G. Bettencourt
fairfax.description: Fairfax is a 6x12 bitmap font for terminals, text editors, IDEs, etc. It supports many scripts and a large number of Unicode blocks as well as constructed scripts as encoded in the Under-ConScript Unicode Registry, pseudographics and semigraphics, and tons of private use characters.
fairfax.name: Fairfax

fairfax-hd.author: Rebecca G. Bettencourt
fairfax-hd.description: Fairfax HD is a halfwidth scalable monospace font for terminals, text editors, IDEs, etc. It supports many scripts and a large number of Unicode blocks as well as constructed scripts as encoded in the Under-ConScript Unicode Registry, pseudographics and semigraphics, and tons of private use characters.
fairfax-hd.name: Fairfax HD

fairfax-hd-hax.author: Rebecca G. Bettencourt
fairfax-hd-hax.description: Fairfax Hax HD adds ligatures for programming, which is apparently a thing, to Fairfax HD: a halfwidth scalable monospace font for terminals, text editors, IDEs, etc.
fairfax-hd-hax.name: Fairfax Hax HD

fairfax-serif.author: Rebecca G. Bettencourt
fairfax-serif.description: Fairfax is a 6x12 bitmap font for terminals, text editors, IDEs, etc. It supports many scripts and a large number of Unicode blocks as well as constructed scripts as encoded in the Under-ConScript Unicode Registry, pseudographics and semigraphics, and tons of private use characters.
fairfax-serif.name: Fairfax Serif

font3270.author: Ricardo Bánffy
font3270.description: This font is derived from the x3270 font, which, in turn, was translated from the one in Georgia Tech's 3270tool, which was itself hand-copied from a 3270 series terminal.

fragment-mono.author: Wei H
fragment-mono.description: Fragment Mono is a monospaced coding version of Helvetica created by modifying and extending Nimbus Sans by URW Design Studio.
fragment-mono.name: Fragment Mono

gnu-freefont.author: Primož Peterlin, Steve White
gnu-freefont.description: GNU FreeFont is a free family of scalable outline fonts, suitable for general use on computers and for desktop publishing. It is Unicode-encoded for compatibility with all modern operating systems.
gnu-freefont.name: GNU Freefont

go-mono.author: Bigelow & Holmes
go-mono.description: The Go font was created especially for readability in the Go programming language. It’s a humanist, slab serif font created by the famous Bigelow & Holmes foundry.
go-mono.name: Go Mono

gohufont-11.author: Hugo Chargois
gohufont-11.description: Gohufont is a monospace bitmap font well suited for programming and terminal use. It is intended to be very legible and offers very discernable glyphs for all characters, including signs and symbols. In 11 or 14 pixels.
gohufont-11.name: Gohufont 11

gohufont-14.author: Hugo Chargois
gohufont-14.description: Gohufont is a monospace bitmap font well suited for programming and terminal use. It is intended to be very legible and offers very discernable glyphs for all characters, including signs and symbols. In 11 or 14 pixels.
gohufont-14.name: Gohufont 14

heterodox-mono.author: Hao Chi Kiang
heterodox-mono.description: A Didone-esque Monospaced Typeface based on Alexey Kryukov's Old Standard TT.
heterodox-mono.name: Heterodox Mono

ia-writer-mono.author: Oliver Reichenstein, Bold Monday, Mike Abbink, Paul van der Laan, Pieter van Rosmalen
ia-writer-mono.name: iA Writer Mono

ibm-vga.author: IBM
ibm-vga.description: With VGA, 9-dot character cells were now the default, and the resulting 9x16 glyphs make up the famous font which remains most strongly associated with ASCII art on the PC, and probably with the entire DOS era in general.
ibm-vga.name: IBM VGA 9x16

inconsolata.author: Raph Levien
inconsolata.description: Inconsolata is a monospace font, designed for code listings and the like, in print. First and foremost, it is a humanist sans design.
inconsolata.name: Inconsolata

inconsolata-otf.author: Raph Levien
inconsolata-otf.description: Inconsolata is a monospace font, designed for code listings and the like, in print. This is the original OTF version.
inconsolata-otf.name: Inconsolata OTF

inconsolata-go.author: Raph Levien
inconsolata-go.description: Inconsolata is a monospace font, designed for code listings and the like, in print. InconsolataGo is Inconsolata with straight quotes.
inconsolata-go.name: InconsolataGo

inconsolata-g.author: Leonardo Maffi
inconsolata-g.description: A customized version of Inconsolata, with straight quotes, a dotted zero, and various other tweaks.
inconsolata-g.name: Inconsolata-g

input.author: David Jonathan Ross
input.name: Input
input.description: Input is a flexible system of fonts designed specifically for code
input.variants: A download can be customized with dozens of weights, widths, dotted or slashed zeroes, and other styles.

intel-one-mono.name: Intel One Mono
intel-one-mono.description: Identifying the typographically underserved low-vision developer audience, the Intel One Mono typeface was designed for maximum legibility to address developers' fatigue and eyestrain and reduce coding errors.
intel-one-mono.author: Intel Brand Team, VMLY&R, Frere-Jones Type

league.author: Tyler Fink
league.description: League Mono is a mashup of sorts, inspired by some beautiful forms found in both Fira Mono, Libertinus Mono, and Courier(?!).
league.name: League Mono
league.variants: League Mono is a variable font and can be downloaded in dozens of weights and widths, but no italics.

lekton.author: Accademia di Belle Arti di Urbino
lekton.name: Lekton

lotion.author: Nina Belikova
lotion.description: A free monospace font for programming! There are variants with and without ligatures.
lotion.name: Lotion

luculent.author: Andrew Kensler
luculent.description: Luculent is a narrow typeface with full bold, italic versions, each covering 643 characters. All glyphs are distinct and full of character. Additionally, the italics bring a wonderful twist to what is already an outstanding and unique font.
luculent.name: Luculent

martian-mono.author: Roman Shamin, Evil Martians
martian-mono.description: Martian Mono is a monospaced version of the Martian Grotesk font for code style design.
martian-mono.name: Martian Mono

monocraft.author: Idrees Hassan
monocraft.description: The monospaced font for developers who like Minecraft a bit too much.
monocraft.name: Monocraft

monoflow.author: Prof. Hans R. Heitmann, Johannes Ammon
monoflow.description: A monospace typeface with unique character and beautiful spacing.
monoflow.name: Monoflow

nanum-gothic-coding.author: NAVER Corp.
nanum-gothic-coding.name: Nanum Gothic Coding
nanum-gothic-coding.description: 나눔고딕코딩체는 지난 2008년 10월 9일 발표된 나눔고딕을 바탕으로 개발자들의 코딩 환경에 최적화시킨 글꼴입니다.

opendyslexic.author: Abbie Gonzalez
opendyslexic.description: OpenDyslexic is a typeface designed against some common symptoms of dyslexia.
opendyslexic.name: OpenDyslexic Mono

overpass.author: Delve Withrington
overpass.description: An open source font family inspired by Highway Gothic.
overpass.name: Overpass Mono

oxygen.author: Vernon Adams
oxygen.description: Oxygen was created to work well in KDE, and this mono variation is a great choice for programmers on Linux.
oxygen.name: Oxygen Mono

plex-mono.author: Bold Monday, Mike Abbink
plex-mono.description: Meet the IBM Plex® typeface, our new corporate typeface family. It’s global, it’s versatile and it’s distinctly IBM.
plex-mono.name: IBM Plex Mono

proggy-vector.author: Tristan Grimmer
proggy-vector.description: A vector graphics variant of the venerable Proggy font. You can also opt for dotted zeroes or crossed sevens and zeds.
proggy-vector.name: Proggy Vector

quinze.author: James Kilfiger
quinze.description: A narrow monospaced font, for programming and terminal emulators. It is designed to be narrow, and allow 132 columns to be comfortably fitted on a screen.
quinze.name: Quinze

redhat.author: Jeremy Mickel
redhat.description: In our font family, each character is made up of perfect circles and straight, even lines.
redhat.name: Red Hat Mono

scientifica.author: Akshay Oppiliappan
scientifica.description: Tall and condensed bitmap font for geeks.
scientifica.name: Scientifica

serious-sans.author: Kyle Beechly
serious-sans.description: A legible monospace font for playful professionals. Comic Sans for hackers.
serious-sans.name: Serious Sans

sometype-mono.author: Ryoichi Tsunekawa
sometype-mono.description: Sometype Mono is a monospaced font family for coding and tabular layout. Consists of 6 styles so far.
sometype-mono.name: Sometype Mono

source-code-pro.author: Paul D. Hunt
source-code-pro.description: Source Code Pro is a set of OpenType fonts that have been designed to work well in user interface (UI) environments.
source-code-pro.name: Source Code Pro
source-code-pro.variants: A variable font that can be downloaded in 7 weights plus italics.

space.author: Colophon Foundry
space.description: Commissioned for the 2016 update of Google Fonts. The evergreen touchstone for Space Mono is Aldo Novarese’s Microgramma, 1952 (and later Eurostile, 1962).
space.name: Space Mono

spleen.author: Frederic Cambus
spleen.description: Monospaced bitmap fonts. Spleen started as a personal challenge.
spleen.name: Spleen

twilio-sans-mono.author: Sharp Type
twilio-sans-mono.description: Twilio worked very closely with the type foundry, Sharp Type over the course of two years to develop a welcoming and adaptable typeface.
twilio-sans-mono.name: Twilio Sans Mono

victor-mono.author: Rune B
victor-mono.description: Victor Mono is a programming font with semi-connected cursive italics and some symbol ligatures
victor-mono.name: Victor Mono
